intro: Gamochaeta oreophila, commonly known as the mountain gamochaeta, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high elevations, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and lance-shaped, while its flowers are small and clustered in a head. Gamochaeta oreophila is often found in alpine environments, contributing to the biodiversity of these unique ecosystems.
